revised_title: New Insights into the Substructure of Brain Synapses and Motor Endplates
tldr: This study provides new insights into the substructure of brain synapses and motor endplates. The researchers discovered an intricate association of smooth endoplasmic reticulum, microtubules, and synaptic vesicles at the presynaptic grid-active zone of synapses. They suggest that the presynaptic dense projections in conventional material may, in part, originate from improperly fixed smooth endoplasmic reticulum at these points. This finding may be related to calcium ion translocation and the function of the presynaptic membrane.
